title: (Global Oil Gas) Senior Data Scientist
description:
This role required candidate to permanently relocate at Dhahran, Saudi Arabia.

About the Company



This company engages in the exploration, production, transportation, and sale of crude oil and natural gas. It operates through the following segments: Upstream, Downstream, and Corporate. The Upstream segment includes crude oil, natural gas and natural gas liquids exploration, field development, and production. The Downstream segment focuses on refining, logistics, power generation, and the marketing of crude oil, petroleum and petrochemical products, and related services to international and domestic customers. The Corporate segment offers supporting services including human resources, finance, and information technology. The company was founded on May 29, 1933 and is headquartered in Dhahran, Saudi Arabia.

Job Summary

We are seeking a Data Scientist to join the Sales & Operations Planning Division's (S&OP) under the Global Optimizer Department. S&OP's primary responsibility is to optimize crude allocation and operations across global manufacturing facilities. title: Lecturer/ Senior Lecturer in Computer Graphics/Vision
description:

Located in Christchurch, New Zealand


Full-time at 37.5 hours per week (1.0 FTE)
Continuing (i.e. permanent) position


What You Will Do

We invite applications for a Lecturer/Senior Lecturer position (equivalent to Assistant Professor/Associate Professor in the US System) working in the area of Computer Graphics, Computer Vision or related fields. Exceptional candidates in other fields of computer science will be considered.

You will contribute to teaching in undergraduate and postgraduate subjects. You will develop a strong research programme, including supervising postgraduate students and seeking external research funding. You will also participate in departmental and university administration. The appointee will be expected to collaborate with other academics in the department, and to develop links with the wider computer science research community at local, national and international levels.

Who You Are

Applicants must hold a Ph.D. degree in Computer Science (or equivalent) and have a demonstrated record of published research in Computer Graphics, Computer Vision or a closely-aligned research field (such as algorithms, scientific visualization, and machine learning methods for graphics, vision, and/or multi-modal models). The successful candidate will have a commitment to excellence in teaching Graphics and related courses, and supervising research projects at both undergraduate and postgraduate levels.

At the University of Canterbury, we strive for inclusivity and diversity. We understand that some candidates may hesitate to apply unless they meet every criterion. Our hiring decisions strive to go beyond traditional qualifications and job experience. If you're interested in applying but unsure about meeting all requirements or need extra support, please inform us. We also encourage you to share your preferred pronouns at any stage of the recruitment process.

Who You Will Work With

The Department of Computer Science and Software Engineering is a strong and forward-looking department, dedicated to excellence in both research and teaching. We aspire to be a productive, dynamic, creative and inspiring community that maintains an inclusive, welcoming and supportive environment in which students and staff alike can flourish.

Our department is one of the largest at University of Canterbury, and one of the fastest growing in student numbers. We teach a diverse range of students from programmes across the University. We take care in supporting students in their learning and we are well resourced to help you with your teaching. Our teaching activities are highly collaborative, both within the Department and University wide. Our teaching teams are student-centred, proactive and feedback-seeking, and work in an open reflective cycle of design, deliver and review. Our diverse research interests and strong collaborative connections span many Departments across campus, and internationally.

Opportunities for collaboration within the Department are strong, with several research groups addressing fields relating to computer graphics, including deep learning, computer vision, immersive gaming, augmented reality, spatial interactive systems, and semi-autonomous robotic systems. There are also opportunities for collaboration with other groups across the University, including the Human Interface Technology Lab (HITLab, predominantly interested in AR/VR) and the School of Product Design (Applied Immersive Game Design), as well as the Southern Hemisphere's largest Digital Screen Campus, currently under development.

The opportunity is here now for you to help build the future of our department. For more information about our department and team, please visit our website.

Please take a virtual tour of our Engineering facilities.

Why UCUniversity of Canterbury is in Christchurch, the gateway to the South Island of New Zealand. Christchurch is a very desirable place to live. We have a lot of green space, great bike routes, and access to the sea and mountains (which you can see from our department building) all within one-hour drive from the city.

A unique bequest funded endowment (Erskine fund) that supports an extensive visiting Fellowship programme
Widely accessible sabbatical provision
University and Faculty scholarship support for graduate students
Generous annual leave provisions
Flexible working arrangements
Supportive working environment
Professional development opportunities
Living in Aotearoa New Zealand

We are also committed to accessible higher education, service to the community and the encouragement of talent without barriers of distance, wealth, class, gender or ethnicity. We produce graduates and support staff who are engaged with their communities, empowered to act for good and determined to make a difference in the world. At the University of Canterbury, we have a diverse, culture-rich, and cooperative environment with policies and practices that ensure all staff and students are given the opportunity and support to grow as individuals and as part of the wider community. Applications that promote our offering a diverse and inclusive workplace are especially encouraged.

Universities in New Zealand do not have a tenure system as compared to North American programmes and academic staff are continuing (i.e. permanent) employees upon appointment. Promotion to higher levels is based upon performance in all three keys areas: teaching, research and administrative responsibilities.

Applications for this position must be submitted online through our careers website and should include:


a cover letter;
a full academic CV with contact information of three academic referees;
a list of publications, highlighting up to three most significant contributions;

title: Pou Arataki Mauri Tūhono | Project Lead Mauri Tūhono
description:
Mō te Pakihi | About the Organisation:

Mauri Tūhono is a timeless, forever approach to biodiversity across the Wellington Region - a kaupapa pūmau looking beyond ourselves to ensure the protection of te taiao for future mokopuna.

Mauri Tūhono is a kaupapa for everyone, everywhere. It is co-chaired and designed by mana whenua, communities, DOC and supported by the Greater Wellington Regional Council (GWRC).

The framework, named “Kaipupuri Taonga ki te Ao Whānui” is premised upon taiao centric thinking, meaning the environment has the first and last say in how we contribute to its health and wellbeing. This ethos underpins what, where, how and when to do things and is not a prescription about nature, it is the Mauri Tūhono way. As a framework, it entrusts you to understand and follow the mauri, the dynamic flow of energy that propels you toward the best outcomes for te taiao. Mauri exists through connection, of people to place. In essence, this is Mauri Tūhono.

Mauri oho, Mauri rere, Mauri tau, Mauri Tūhono e!

Mō te Tūranga | About the Role:

The Pou Arataki Mauri Tūhono will work with the co-chairs to lead out He Hononga, the establishment phase. This requires working collaboratively to design a successful programme of action. It requires right leadership and sustainable financial management, to activate and progress the shifts for te taiao that are described in Kaipupuri Taonga ki te Ao Whānui. The ideal candidate will oversee and facilitate positive outcomes for mana whenua, community and kawanatanga. This will set the foundations for the following phase, Mahi Tūhono - implementation and transformation.

This is a fixed term role for 12 months to support the mahi to move from planning to implementation. You can be based in the central Wellington GWRC office or their new Masterton office.

Mōu | About You:

The Pou Arataki will feel and understand the kaupapa of Mauri Tūhono. You’ll have a passion for te taiao, will be an advocate for the special places and people of our rohe and along with understanding the mauri of the kaupapa, you’ll have the technical skills to complement. You’ll be able to balance high level strategic thinking while employing practical, on the ground approaches. With experience in project leadership and facilitation, you’ll move through challenges and with skills in planning and implementation, you’ll move this project to the next stages.

You’ll operate with tika and pono which in turn means you have strong relationship skills. A deep understanding of tikanga and mātauranga Māori as it relates to te taiao and an understanding of Te Tiriti o Waitangi will mean you are comfortable in different spaces connecting with diverse groups bringing them together on the Mauri Tūhono.

Ngā Painga | What we offer:

We’ll encourage you to grow and prosper with a range of learning and development opportunities, internal secondments and career progression. We believe we have a friendly and inclusive culture supporting you to have a sense of belonging, where you can reflect your personal and cultural identity in the way that you work and get involved in social clubs and staff networks. You can work to suit your life and whānau with the flexible working policy.

Your wellbeing is our priority – we’ll provide medical and trauma insurance, support through our employee assistance programme or Manawa Ora providers, generous annual and sick leave, along with Tangihanga leave and support.

Help us use our collective aspirations, knowledge and resources for a shared legacy so we can intertwine our restoration efforts together to weave a korowai. So that the mauri of te taiao will be sustained for all. He Mauri Tūhono!

Me tono mai inaīanei | Apply Now!

Applications close Sunday, 8 September 2024.

To find out more, please get in touch with Kylie Savage on 027 404 0383 or Orissa Plimmer on 027 935 9290 for a confidential kōrero and/or to receive a copy of the position description.

To apply for this vacancy you MUST be a New Zealand citizen, resident, or have already secured the right to work in New Zealand and therefore hold a valid visa.

At the appropriate stage we will request your references, we ask that you do not include them on your CV when applying.

Transpower owns and operates New Zealand's National Grid - the unique High Voltage transmission network connecting areas of generation with towns and cities across New Zealand.

With a whole-of-industry view of the electricity sector, we are at the forefront of the country's pending electricity transformation. Our team is working hard to enable accelerated electrification, and a sustainable net carbon zero future.

About The Team

Our Grid Delivery division is accountable for the delivery of all work across New Zealand's transmission network. This includes project and maintenance work, delivered in conjunction with our service provider organisations. Transpower delivers approximately $300M capex and $100M in opex per annum. Our Grid Works Delivery team ensures Transpower's asset management plan is delivered, built, and commissioned in a manner which meets the organisations strategic objectives.

About The Opportunity

Ideally based in Wellington, although Auckland, Palmerston North, or Christchurch will be considered, you'll be one of fifteen Investigation Project Managers operating in a playmaker role which will require you to reach into multiple parts of the business (and beyond where the projects are for external customers), including our Tactical Engineering, Asset Planning, System Planning, Economics, Property, Environment, Customer and Commercial teams.

Part time or job share options may be available for the right candidates.

While you'll be part of delivering projects, you'll also work with project owners in fashioning the scope and bringing players round the table from within and outside the business to work up concepts and solution studies that deliver great projects.

You'll lead and coordinate the work of a project team to manage and deliver investigation projects, with the development of concise, high-quality business cases and:



Ensure a seamless transition between the investigation and delivery phases of projects

Develop and manage effective relationships with customers and stakeholders to ensure expectations are met, there are no surprises and project outcomes are successfully delivered

Anticipate, identify and manage/raise issues and risks and ensure accurate and timely milestone and metrics



Projects can range from $250k to $100m plus. The team assesses a range of project types, including substation switchgear and secondary systems replacements and upgrades, lines reconductoring and strategic upgrades, building new substations, HVDC and reactive support projects, and strategic initiatives to support policy / specification updates.

You'll be involved in enabling major internal strategies such as Net Zero Grid Pathways and delivering investigations for Transpower's large capital projects, while also supporting external customers with their electrification projects. Example projects would include establishing new grid exit points (GXPs) for distribution networks, upgrading existing GXPs for industrial customers pursuing decarbonisation in their processes, and creating grid injection points (GIPs) for new battery energy storage systems (BESS), solar and wind farms.

You'll engage at all levels across Transpower, with our customers, stakeholders, consultants, and service providers. It's mentally stimulating and challenging work!

About You

Customer-centric, you'll use your outstanding relationship management skills to work collaboratively to ensure a shared vision with expectations and commercially successful project outcomes being achieved.

You'll have previously worked broadly and at pace, including with geographically based teams, to investigate find solutions, and solve problems.

To be considered, your CV and cover letter will be clearly articulate



A minimum of five years' experience in running successful projects (ideally in energy sector/critical infrastructure) using sound project management techniques and methodologies. This may be underpinned by a formal qualification or the desire to gain project management certification

Understanding of engineering or significant infrastructure projects and their life cycles

Experience in the development of complex commercial business cases and approval processes

Proven ability to question astutely while managing expectations and relationships

Well-developed and concise oral and written communication skills

Experience of delivering resilience-driven work programmes e.g., Seismic/fire building upgrades, flood/tsunami mitigations, slope stability remediation



Join us at Transpower

Aotearoa is powered by the people who work here. Every home, every marae, every electric vehicle, every hospital relies on the electricity we manage and deliver. This is your opportunity to join us on a mission that affects all New Zealanders, every day, and long into the future.

With over 28 nationalities, our people provide diverse perspectives, knowledge, and deep and varied experience which they love to share.

Wellbeing is supported with a range of employee health and wellness benefits (check them out here: https://www.transpower.co.nz/about-us/careers-transpower/staff-benefits), on the job learning, professional development, and career progression over time.

Next steps

To play a key role in helping to deliver a net zero carbon future for Aotearoa please review the position description below or via our website and apply without delay.

Role closes Sunday 15 September; however, applications will be reviewed as they are received and exploratory conversations may commence prior to the close date to facilitate shortlisting.

title: Vocational Training Specialist
description:
Facilitate technical training with the support of subject matter experts

Collaborate with industry to create tailored curricula and assessments

Work sector wide to ensure the workforce can deliver a net-zero carbon future



Be part of an exciting change journey at pace. Bring your expertise and passion for delivering exceptional training to the National Grid!

Our core purpose is to empower the energy future for New Zealand - a future that delivers a net-zero carbon economy and a reliable and secure electricity system. As a lifeline utility with over 900 employees and an extended Service Provider whānau of more than 3,000, we are pivotal in delivering critical infrastructure nationwide.

As demand for electrification accelerates to meet climate goals, our workforce—and that of our Service Providers—must scale significantly. By 2030, we anticipate a 60-100% increase in the service providers required to maintain and develop the National Grid.

To support this growth, The Sector Workforce Development Group, part of our People Division, is committed to defining, developing, and delivering top-tier vocational training programs that ensure our people, and those who work with us, possess the skills and capability to undertake their roles effectively and safety. The group also plays a key role in promoting transmission sector jobs and career pathways to support growth.

About The Team

The Training and Learning team within the Sector Workforce Development Group is focused on enhancing the quality, efficiency, and effectiveness of training programs through pedagogical excellence. By developing and implementing best practices in teaching methodologies, providing professional development for trainers, and ensuring a learner-centred approach, the team will foster an engaging and supportive learning environment.

This commitment to continuous improvement in teaching and learning practices ensures that Transpower employees and service provider staff are well-equipped with the knowledge and skills necessary to excel in their roles and contribute to the safety and reliability of the National Grid.

About The Opportunity

In this role for an experienced trainer who has worked at supervisory level, you will enjoy varied and intellectually challenging work as you:



Support the delivery of lines, substation, and power technician training and facilitation performed by contractors' and subject matter experts.

collaborate closely with industry and stakeholders to create tailored curricula and assessments, including for our Grid & Systems Operations areas.

ensure high participant completion rates.

supplement national coordination centre and national grid operations centre trainer/ facilitators.

deliver training critical to building capability of people working with key systems, processes, and tools used to deliver the management and operation of the New Zealand power and market systems.

supporting the Manger of Training and Learning.



Ultimately this role will enable you to join a Category 1 Private Training Establishment and contribute to exciting change which will impact electricity sector training pathways for future generations. You'll be the right-hand person for the Training Manager and will provide operational support and development for our trainers and trainees.

What will you bring?

Drive, pace, and a passion for delivering facilitation and training excellence! You will be someone who likes being hands on but who can see how to enable the Training and Learning Strategy operationally. Electricity sector experience isn't essential, however your CV and cover letter will clearly demonstrate:



Deep experience in training and learning methodologies and tools, with a strong focus on learner achievement.

Training practitioner level experience in complex training technical environments. You ideally will have experience guiding less experienced trainers and supporting the varied needs of diverse adult learners.

Proven ability to work with technical subject manager experts to extract information needed to design appropriate learning solutions.

Strong planning skills and attention to detail.

Outstanding communication skills.

Experience in supporting and mentoring trainers and learners.



Desirable



Experience and an understanding of te ao Māori principles and their application in the workplace and/or education environment are highly desirable.

Experience in managing academic risk and quality assurance processes.

Knowledge of the electricity supply industry, SCADA applications, and New Zealand Power System. (This could be experience with training on complex real time applications)

Aotearoa is powered by the people who work here. Every home, every marae, every electric vehicle, every hospital relies on the electricity we manage and deliver. This is your opportunity to join us on a mission that affects all New Zealanders, every day and long into the future.

title: Operations Planning Engineer - Wellington
description:
Transpower owns and operates New Zealand's National Grid, the high-voltage transmission network that links generation sites to towns and cities nationwide.

As the System Operator, we play a pivotal role in running the wholesale electricity market and managing the power system in real-time. At the core of New Zealand's power system, we connect electricity generators with retailers via the wholesale market, ensuring the seamless flow of electricity through Transpower's high-voltage network to local lines companies and large industrial customers.

Our team is united by a shared purpose: Whakamana i te mauri hiko tū mai Aotearoa - Empowering New Zealand's energy future.

About The Team

The Network Modelling and Commissioning Team, part of the Operations Planning Group, delivers engineering expertise to ensure the safe and secure integration of transmission assets into the power system. The team also evaluates and coordinates updates to transmission and generator asset capability information within the Operations tools suite, adapting to changes in the transmission network.

Working across various time frames, the team addresses everything from near real-time operations to major projects and long-term grid changes.

About The Opportunity

It's an exciting time to be in the industry! Driven by the goal of achieving a net-zero carbon energy future by 2050, the New Zealand electricity industry is on the brink of transformation. The shift towards a more distributed and renewable-based electricity system, along with the increasing demand for electricity, presents the industry with both exciting opportunities and challenges.

Based in Wellington, you will work specifically with the Network Modelling & Commissioning Team. In this intermediate-level role, your key responsibilities will include:



Reviewing and assessing commissioning plans for transmission assets to ensure compliance with industry standards and company policies.

Ensuring that commissioning plans reflect the efficient execution of all commissioning activities, maintaining safety for both plant and personnel while safeguarding the security of the power system.

Coordinating with project managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to identify and resolve issues in commissioning plans.

Conducting engineering assessments of asset capability information and coordinate updates to network models and advanced engineering applications in response to changes in the transmission network and projects involving modelling of renewable energy sources.

Managing the communication process of asset capability changes from asset owners to the system operator, ensuring this information is effectively conveyed to other operations teams within the division



About You

Your ability to innovate, collaborate, and adapt to change will ensure your success in our operational environment. As a problem solver, you thrive on piecing together complex puzzles!

Naturally curious, you're eager to understand how your work fits into the bigger picture, all while staying focused on the task at hand.

To be considered, your CV and covering letter will demonstrate:



A bachelor's degree in Power Systems or Electrical/ Electronic Engineering.

Knowledge of power system operations (electricity generation / transmission / distribution networks) and protection systems.

Minimum of 3 years of experience in the energy sector, specifically in transmission asset commissioning or a related field.

Experience in assessing and validating commissioning plans and procedures.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, and attention to detail.

Effective communication and interpersonal skills.



Experience with computer-based tools and applications will be highly regarded. Training will be provided to complement your skills.

Join us at Transpower

Aotearoa is powered by the people who work here. Every home, every marae, every electric vehicle, every hospital relies on the electricity we manage and deliver. This is your opportunity to join us on a mission that affects all New Zealanders, every day, and long into the future.

title: Power Systems Engineer/Senior Engineer
description:
Analyse Aotearoa's power system security & engage with industry participants

Develop/validate dynamic simulation models of transmission & generation assets

Support development & deployment of power system tools & ancillary services



Our core purpose is to empower the energy future for New Zealand - a future that delivers a net-zero carbon economy and a reliable and secure electricity system.

About The Team

The System Operator Power Systems group is responsible for providing a service of multifaceted power system modelling and analysis, engineering, and risk and assurance management to enable Transpower as System Operator to meet its principal performance obligations under the Electricity Industry Participation Code and successfully operate the New Zealand electricity market and power system today and into the future. All teams within the group play key roles in delivering this service.

Along with both Power System Development and Engineering Assurance teams, the Power System Engineering team provides real-time power system engineering support for Operations, power system modelling, including dynamic modelling, study of existing and future power system risks and technologies, and work with industry participants to understand how their assets perform against their obligations.

Examples of the team's deliverables are here:

System Security Forecast | Transpower

Dynamic stability reports

EMI DIgSILENT Power Factory case files

Work at the heart of the electricity sector with the System Operator!

If you are a power system professional who loves a technical challenge and has a passion for renewable energy and strategic thinking you will find working for the System Operator gives you the opportunity to work at the very heart of enabling a net-zero carbon future.

Working closely with other power system professionals across Transpower, you'll explore and communicate the challenges and opportunities that the transition to a 100% renewable electricity system will bring.

Using your outstanding analytical and communication skills, you'll help us engage with the Electricity Authority, and industry participants to make the required changes to the market, standards, and the Code to enable a secure and resilient power system for New Zealand for generations to come.

What will you bring?

We are looking for Engineers with experience in time domain simulations, dynamic modelling, and analysing operational challenges of integrating renewable generation. You may be working for a Transmission System Operator, Grid Owner, or Engineering Consultancy, utilising well-developed communication and influencing skills, and an ability to understand, model and analyse complex power systems.

You'll enjoy working both autonomously and as part of a team, with caring knowledgeable peers as you consider the implications of system stability, and system security to power system operations.

At Engineer level, to be considered, your CV and cover letter will demonstrate:



A bachelor's degree in electrical engineering, or related field.

Knowledge, and at least 3+ years' experience in modelling, and power system analysis. Where applicable, please highlight any reports you have supported or contributed to.

Knowledge with Power System Analysis Tools to support building dynamic power system models and performing load flow and time domain simulations; ideally Siemens PSS®E or DIgSILENT PowerFactory.

High level, real world analytical skills, problem solving and outstanding attention to detail.



To be a "Senior" Engineer in the Transpower context - you will also demonstrate:



7+ years knowledge and experience in power system operations or transmission planning.

The ability to lead power system studies and/or projects and prepare/validate powerflow cases and dynamic models in PowerFactory (or similar) for conducting power system analysis and simulations.

Demonstrated ability to coach and mentor others and grow capability - both technical and soft skills

Previous experience working with/leading a team through influence to deliver technical projects.

CPEng or an international equivalent. Desirable is a master's degree or PhD degree in electrical engineering, power electronics, or related field, and membership of professional affiliations and industry working groups, such as CIGRE, IEEE, IET or EEA.

About the Role

An exciting opportunity has come up in our Managed Services team, working with clients from around the world using some of the newest cloud technologies and getting exposure to different technology stacks. We're looking for someone with experience working on/supporting Azure Cloud Administration and MSSQL Database Administration.

This role involves applying your excellent communication and problem solving skills to provide support and suggest enhancements to maintain the Data Warehouse (DW), Business Intelligence (BI) and Database solutions for our Managed Services clients across Australia, New Zealand and the UK, for both Cloud and on premise solutions.




What you bring to the table

2+ years experience in Azure administration or development/support using Azure functions
Intermediate to senior level skill set as a MSSQL Database Administrator (DBA) with 3+ years hands-on experience
5+ years experience working in teams to provide IT Support to clients
Strong knowledge of virtual machines, cloud networking, compute, storage, network components, including backup, monitoring and DR environment requirements.
An understanding of the division of responsibility for designing and maintaining a secure cloud environment
Understanding of key Information security principals
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
An advantage: Intermediate to Senior level of skills in shell scripting and high-level programming languages like Python, R
Linux server support (advantageous)




What your day to day would include

Database administration including technical support, health checks and performance monitoring/management in both on-premise environments and/or Azure Cloud services
Monitoring systems and batch processes.
Responding to client queries.
Investigating and resolving issues.
Designing and developing enhancements to client MSSQL Database and/or DW/BI solutions using best practice methodologies.
Providing application technical support
